{{also|Billig}} ==Danish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{rhymes|da|i}} ===Etymology 1=== ====Adjective==== {{da-adj}} # [[cheap]] =====Inflection===== {{da-infl-adj||st}} ===Etymology 2=== {{nonlemma}} ====Verb==== {{head|da|verb form}} # {{imperative of|da|billige}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|goh|billīh||appropriate}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*biliz||merciful, kind, decent, fair}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{a|Northern Germany|standard Theaterdeutsch}} {{IPA|de|[ˈbɪlɪç]}} * {{a|Upper German}} {{IPA|de|[ˈbɪlɪkʰ]}} * {{audio|de|De-billig.ogg|Audio Northern Germany:}}, {{audio|de|De-billig2.ogg|Upper Germany:}}, {{audio|de|De-at-billig.ogg|Austria:}} * {{hyphenation|de|bil|lig}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|er|sten}} # {{lb|de|formal}} [[appropriate]], [[meet]], [[fair]] #: {{ux|de|Die Strafe ist '''billig''' und recht.|The punishment is '''appropriate''' and just.}} # {{lb|de|informal}} [[cheap]] {{gloss|low-priced}} #: {{ux|de|In Deutschland sind Lebensmittel '''billiger''' als in andern europäischen Ländern.|In Germany, groceries are '''cheaper''' than in other European countries.}} #: {{syn|de|wohlfeil|günstig|preisgünstig|kostengünstig|niedrigpreisig|preiswert}} #: {{ant|de|teuer|hochpreisig}} # {{lb|de|low colloquial}} [[cheap]] {{gloss|of low quality, mediocre}} #: {{ux|de|Das Vorgehen der Regierung ist ein '''billiges''' Ablenkungsmanöver.|The government's course of action is a '''cheap''' diversionary tactic.}} #: {{ant|de|edel|hochwertig}} ====Usage notes==== The meaning “low-priced” only arises in the end of the 18th century and has been very colloquial and frowned upon until the end of the 19th century, the negative meaning having to arise even later after this word has attained domination in expressing the sense of cheapness in German. This word in the sense “cheap” is still known to be slightly colloquial, so, in formal speech, and because of its multiple senses, like {{m|de|günstig}} it is avoided in favour of circumscriptions or ungainly adjectives like {{m|de|preisgünstig}} and {{m|de|niedrigpreisig}}. Actually, in [[legalese|legal writing]] the original meaning is the expected one. The classical word for “cheap” is {{m|de|wohlfeil}}, the use of which now is restricted to chosen style. ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj|billig|billiger|billigst}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|spottbillig}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:DWDS}} * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Norwegian Bokmål== ===Etymology=== From {{der|nb|gml|billich}} ===Adjective=== {{head|nb|adjective|neuter singular|billig|definite singular and plural|billige|comparative|billigere|indefinite plural|billigst|definite plural|billigste}} # {{l|en|cheap}}, {{l|en|inexpensive}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|nb|dyr}} ===References=== * {{R:The Bokmål Dictionary}} ---- ==Norwegian Nynorsk== ===Etymology=== From {{der|nn|gml|billich}} ===Adjective=== {{head|nn|adjective|neuter singular|billig|definite singular and plural|billige|comparative|billigare|indefinite plural|billigast|definite plural|billigaste}} # {{alternative form of|nn|billeg|nocap=1}} ===References=== * {{R:The Nynorsk Dictionary}} ---- ==Swedish== ===Etymology=== From {{der|sv|gml|billik}}, {{m|gml|billich}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{audio|sv|Sv-billig.ogg|Audio}} ===Adjective=== {{sv-adj}} # [[cheap]]; of low price, of little worth # cheap, [[easy]]; requiring little effort # {{lb|sv|dated}} [[reasonable]], [[fair]] #: ''en '''billig''' begäran'' #:: a reasonable request #: ''det är rätt och '''billigt''''' #:: that is fair and square ====Declension==== {{sv-adj-reg}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|sv|dyr}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|sv|billighet}}
